page.title: 18Language
page.content:
{LANGUAGE } The Welsh language predominated until the middle of the 19th century when there was a large influx of English speaking workers. The local place names are mainly Welsh origin.
Nantyglo - coalstream Brynmawr - big hill Garnlydan - wide stony mound Ebbw Vale - vale of gushing water Rhyd-y-Blew - grassy ford Glyncoed - wooded valley Glanyrafon - river bank Coedcae - field of trees Twyncynghordy - assembly house hillock Waungoch - red meadow Blaen-cwm - head of valley Blaenau Gwent - valley heads of Gwent Garn Fach - little heap of stones Pont-y-Gof - blacksmith's bridge
